learning_outcomes.description: Critical Thinking Sessions - Critically analyse research publications
Critical Thinking Sessions - Effectively communicate scientific information
Critical Thinking Sessions - Articulate and discuss your scientific opinions
Critical Thinking Sessions - Write a critical report on the material discussed in a small group discussion
Seminars - Listen, read, analyse and critically evaluate scientific information presented in scientific seminars, and actively participate in seminar discussions
Seminars - Give clear, concise, organised and accurate oral presentations of your own research within the School and University
Seminars - Take successful diary notes during seminars to aid comprehension and recollection of scientific presentations, and to formulate questions for the speaker

assessments.due_date: To be delivered in class in Teaching Week 5
assessments.task_description: Students are required to present a short presentation to introduce their project topic. The requirement and format of this task will follow those of UQ 3MT presentations (threeminutethesis.uq.edu.au).
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be delivered in class in Teaching Week 5.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date: To be submitted through Turnitin from the Blackboard site by 2 pm on Friday in Teaching Week 10.
assessments.task_description: Students are required to develop a critical review of the literature relevant to their research project. See Honours Handbook for more information.
